revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=16:21, 31 October 2010 |action1link=Talk:USS New Ironsides/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=393972153 |action2=WAR |action2date=04:30, 26 March 2011 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/USS New Ironsides |action2result=approved |action2oldid=420482383 |action3=FAC |action3date=18:13, 1 May 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/USS New Ironsides/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=426699831 |topic=History |currentstatus=FA |maindate=August 21, 2012 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA|A-Class=pass|Maritime=yes|ACW=yes|US=y}} {{WikiProject Pennsylvania|class=FA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} {{WikiProject United States|class=FA|importance=Low|USMIL=Yes|ACW=Yes}} }} ==Sister Ships?== The USS New Ironsides, was I think one of three such ships built. What were their names? [[User:PaulinSaudi|Paul, in Saudi]] ([[User talk:PaulinSaudi|talk]]) 23:21, 25 October 2009 (UTC) :As the article says, New Ironsides was "the last and largest of an initial group of three ... ironclads". The other two experimental ships were [[USS Galena (1862)|USS Galena]] and, most successful of the three, [[John Ericsson]]'s [[USS Monitor (1862)|USS Monitor]]. Only Monitor was repeated. Neither New Ironsides nor Galena had any sisters afloat. [[User:Angusmclellan|Angus McLellan]] [[User talk:Angusmclellan|(Talk)]] 00:37, 26 October 2009 (UTC) ::Thank you. The [[USS Galena (1862)|USS Galena]] article makes this quite clear in the first paragraph. [[User:PaulinSaudi|Paul, in Saudi]] ([[User talk:PaulinSaudi|talk]]) 01:06, 26 October 2009 (UTC) The article on the David suggest that the damage from the spar torpedo was significant. I suspect in view of massive nature of Ironsides hull that this article is correct but is there more info available? â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/157.203.255.2|157.203.255.2]] ([[User talk:157.203.255.2|talk]]) 12:35, 21 August 2012 (UTC) :I'm away from my sources, but I don't think that there's any additional info available. The most telling fact about any damage, IMO, is that the ship remained on station for a while longer, which implies that the damage was relatively minor.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 14:26, 21 August 2012 (UTC) == OLD vs. NEW Ironsides == I'm confused. The article is titled "USS New Ironsides" but the infobox refers to "USS Old Ironsides". Is this an error? [[User:Wa3frp|Wa3frp]] ([[User talk:Wa3frp|talk]]) 17:34, 21 August 2012 (UTC) :: The issue is now resolved... see article history[[User:Wa3frp|Wa3frp]] ([[User talk:Wa3frp|talk]]) 22:06, 21 August 2012 (UTC)
